critique: The document establishes a council to support the recovery of the Gulf Coast region after Hurricanes Katrina and Rita. It focuses on coordinating federal resources and support to state, local, and tribal governments, as well as the private sector and community organizations. There is no mention of immigration, civil liberties, or social issues. The order emphasizes federal support and coordination, which suggests a slight increase in federal power. The economic aspect involves providing support, which could be seen as a form of government intervention. The document does not explicitly address ideological issues.
